content: . One RCT compared β-blocker plus amiodarone versus each of those drugs separately; the combination reduced atrial fibrillation significantly better than the β-blocker alone, but not amiodarone alone. Seven RCTs reported short-term mortality, but this outcome was too rare and the sample sizes too small to provide any meaningful comparisons.
